alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 28 at 4:18PM PST until December 01 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Light snow showers will taper off tonight. Heavy snow possible above 3000 feet Wednesday morning through Thursday afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible above 3000 feet and locally 10 to 18 inches above 4000 feet. * WHERE...The winter storm watch includes the eastern Douglas County Foothills above 3000 feet and areas east of Toketee Falls. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow is expected Wednesday evening through Thursday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
